body:

Since the Record orm was not cleaned up before fetching new records on $fetch, a mismatch on the current recordStatus could appear

See next video at 0:18
https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/assets/88380932/ac08df29-8d7f-4dfa-8e14-b6af71cdd89e

**Type of change**

- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- Only feedback task (when fetching record on fetch hook, we need to ensure that the orm is empty)

title: Improve database migrations management
body:
# Description

This PR improves the database migration experience by:

* Providing a new `--revision` param to the `database migrate` command. This will be useful to downgrade DB to a specific version
* A new `database revisions` command to show info about DB revisions.

title: Relax `codecov/patch` threshold to avoid failures
body:
# Description

Relax the `codecov/patch` threshold to avoid CI from failing too often due to small code coverage percentage changes.

Closes #2985

title: Update toast message on queue
body:
# Description
Update the toast message when user try to see record after the last one from a queue.
The message is : `You've reached the end of the data for the ${status} queue.` Where status is pending/discarded/submitted

**Type of change**

- Update toast message

**How Has This Been Tested**

- only feedback task

title: Use different database to run the unit tests

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
The current setup for the unit tests uses the same engine with the same URL for connecting to the database that gets deployed when executing the Argilla server locally. This is not ideal, because if you have played with the server, added datasets, annotated, etc, and then run the unit tests, the database will get erased losing all the work done manually.

Apart from that, the current pytest fixture to yield the DB session is removing all the rows from the tables after the test gets executed instead of rolling back.

I would like a different database to be used to run the unit tests and to roll back the transactions instead of removing all the rows after the test gets executed.

title: Release v1.8.0
body:
# Description

## Added

- `/api/v1/datasets` new endpoint to list and create datasets ([#2615]).
- `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}` new endpoint to get and delete datasets ([#2615]).
- `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}/publish` new endpoint to publish a dataset ([#2615]).
- `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}/questions` new endpoint to list and create dataset questions ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}/fields` new endpoint to list and create dataset fields ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}/questions/{question_id}` new endpoint to delete a dataset questions ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}/fields/{field_id}` new endpoint to delete a dataset field ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/workspaces/{workspace_id}` new endpoint to get workspaces by id ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/responses/{response_id}` new endpoint to update and delete a response ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/datasets/{dataset_id}/records` new endpoint to create and list dataset records ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/me/datasets` new endpoint to list user visible datasets ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/me/dataset/{dataset_id}/records` new endpoint to list  dataset records with user responses ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/me/datasets/{dataset_id}/metrics` new endpoint to get the dataset user metrics ([#2615])
- `/api/v1/me/records/{record_id}/responses` new endpoint to create record user responses ([#2615])
- showing new feedback task datasets in datasets list ([#2719])
- new page for feedback task ([#2680])
- show feedback task metrics ([#2822])
- user can delete dataset in dataset settings page ([#2792])
- Support for Feedback dataset in python client (parent PR [#2615], and nested PRs: [#2949], [#2827], [#2943], [#2945], and [#2962])
- Integration with the HuggingFace Hub ([#2949])

[#2615]: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2615

### Deprecated

- Using argilla with python 3.7 runtime is deprecated and support will be removed from version 1.9.0 ([#2902](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/issues/2902))

title: Update the `.codecov.yml` also for `patch`

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**

This is not a bug actually, but as of https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/pull/2934 we increased the `codecov` threshold, but that was just affecting the `codecov/project` while the `codecov/patch` is still failing most of the times due to still having a pretty constrained margin, so we need to update the configuration for it in https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/blob/develop/.codecov.yml

title: Adds Dockerfile and docker-compose for local development of the UI
body:
# Description

This PR fixes #2982 and #2983. Both problems related with the lack of accurate documentation about how to set up the local development environment of the frontend. Instead of resolving the issues behind, creates a basic docker-compose system that set ups the local environment for you.

This is a very simple approach, that still uses the root docker-compose file. Ideally, it should be in the same docker-compose or just have a common docker-compose.yml for local development purposes.

Closes #2982 and #2983

**Type of change**

title: Missleading documentation on how to build the frontend

labels.name: status: stale
labels.description: Indicates that there is no activity on an issue or pull request

body:
**Describe the bug**
The frontend README explains how to set up the project with `yarn`. The set up does not work with yarn (at least on node 14 and 18). See #2981 for more context.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Clone repository, develop branch, in a machine with node 18 or higher.
2. Follow instructions on https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/blob/develop/frontend/README.md
3. See errors

**Expected behavior**
The project should ideally work yarn or should explain in the documentation README that npm is required.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Ubuntu 22
 - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: develop branch

It seems like the frontend does not work with recent versions of nodejs, only with node 14. There is no information about this requirement in the documentation. See #2981 for more context.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Clone repository, develop branch, in a machine with node 18 or higher.
2. Follow instructions on https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/blob/develop/frontend/README.md or execute https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/blob/develop/scripts/build_frontend.sh
3. See error

**Expected behavior**
The project should ideally work for the current nodejs LTS versions (18) or should explain in the documentation the nodejs version requirement.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: Ubuntu 22
 - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: develop branch

title: New feature: Adds frontend side to allow the users to edit the dataset description
body:
# Description

On the dataset settings page, adds a form field to edit/add a description or annotation guidelines to the dataset. The form has a live preview of the markdown. Both the editor and the markdown renderer are not coupled to the DatasetDescription component so they could be used in any other place if required, for example, when rendering the description somewhere else. I started the VueX ORM implementation but did not finished it as there is no backend for this yet.

While setting up the local environment I noticed that the frontend does not work on recent nodejs versions (tested it on node 18, current LTS) and there is no documentation about this. I only was able to build the frontend with node 14. 

Also, the frontend README is misleading, as it says to use `yarn` which did not work for me, neither on node 18 or 14. It only worked with `npm`.

I'm creating two new issues for this.

**Type of change**

- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- [ ] New cases on DatasetDescription.component.spec.js.
- [ ] New test case on MarkdownEditor.component.spec.js.
- [ ] New test case on MarkdownElement.component.spec.js.

title: Refactor : Stop using total records in front end

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body:
# Description
Since the `total number records` is not include anymore in the call to fetch records (See #2917) , the value have to be removed from the feedback task.

List of impacts by components/model :

1/ FeedbackPagination.component.vue :
the total_records is used to compute the number of total page
it's also used to render the pagination component (if no total_records, the component is not rendered)

2/ CenterFeedbackTask.content.vue :
when total_records change, we reinitiate the flag areResponsesUntouched to true (this help us to show are not a toast on change route or on change filter)
also used to know in which page the user is in order to allow to go to next record or not on submit/discard

3/ RecordFeedbackTaskAndQuestionnaire.content.vue :
it's where the total_records is fetch and insert in the orm
it's used as a flag to show or not a message in case there is no record

4/ FeedbackTask.model.js && feedbackTask.queries.js :
where there is the attribute total_record && queries to update/get the value from the orm

=> When the total record will be removed from the api, we have to clean the front orm and adapt the 3 components to get the toal record from the metrics instead of the previous way


**Type of change**

- Refactor (change restructuring the codebase without changing functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- Feedback task only

title: Add a user-management layer from the Python client

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Even though the users can already be managed through the API, I think it would be much clearer if we also included that within the Python client, to avoid having to define requests to the API via Python to get information about the users in Argilla.

This would prevent users from having to do the following to list Argilla users:

```python
import httpx

rg_client= rg.active_client().client
auth_headers = {"X-Argilla-API-Key": rg_client.token}
http=httpx.Client(base_url=rg_client.base_url, headers=auth_headers)
users = http.get("/api/users").json()
```

**Describe the solution you'd like**

The class to manage the users should allow to create new users, change roles, see their information, delete/remove users, list users, filter users, etc. and any other feature that the current user-management allows via the API.

title: Loading csv file with annotations

labels.name: status: stale
labels.description: Indicates that there is no activity on an issue or pull request

body:
Hola!
I'm trying to load a csv file with token annotations to Argilla. I'm following [this example](https://docs.argilla.io/en/latest/guides/how_to.html?highlight=csv#2.-TokenClassification). In addition to the text, my csv contains a column with the annotation. I'm getting an `ArrowTypeError: Expected bytes, got a 'int' object` when trying to read and load that annotation (see screenshot). It works if I create a `DatasetForTokenClassification` by iterating through the dataset and creating a `TokenClassificationRecord` from each row, but it doesn't when trying to load the csv as a whole. 

[This is the csv file](https://github.com/lirondos/lazaro/blob/master/data/mar2023.csv) I'm trying to load and here is my code: 

```
import argilla as rg
from datasets import Dataset

rg.init(
    api_url="http://localhost:6900/",
    api_key="admin.apikey"
)

def tokens_to_char(text, tok_position, begin_or_end):
    tokens = text.split()
    previous_toks = tokens[:tok_position]
    previous_toks_str = " ".join(previous_toks)
    previous_toks_str = previous_toks_str + " " if begin_or_end == "B" else previous_toks_str
    return len(previous_toks_str)
    
def tokenize(row):
    tokens = row["text"].split(" ")
    return {"tokens": tokens}
    
def myannotations(row):
    annotations = [(
    row["lang"].upper(), 
    tokens_to_char(row["text"], row["start_token"], "B"), 
    tokens_to_char(row["text"], row["end_token"], "E"),
    )]
    print(annotations)
    return {"annotation": annotations}
    
    
# Read the csv file
dataset = Dataset.from_csv("mar2023.csv")
dataset = dataset.select(range(5))
dataset = dataset.rename_column("context", "text")

dataset = dataset.map(tokenize)
dataset = dataset.map(myannotations)

dataset_rg = rg.read_datasets(dataset, task="TokenClassification")
rg.log(dataset_rg, "lazaro")
```
![image](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/assets/23241817/62d37dae-2d20-4d2a-bc61-7c53fbe7012c)

title: Minor fixes and improvements around `rg.FeedbackDataset`
body:
# Description

As requested by @davidberenstein1957, we are now mapping the `fields` and `questions` to their `pydantic.BaseModel` schema, instead of as the default schema for both `FieldSchema` and `QuestionSchema`, respectively; just when pulling from Argilla with `rg.FeedbackDataset.from_argilla`.

Now when pushing a `FeedbackDataset` to the HuggingFace Hub with `push_to_hub`, we are not just pushing the `user_id` and the `value` in the responses, but also the `status`, which can be "submitted", "discarded", or "missing".

Now there's no need to provide the `user_id` when adding record responses, as now the active Argilla user will be used just when pushing the records to Argilla. See the following example:

```python
import argilla as rg

rg.init(api_url="...", api_key="...")

dataset = rg.FeedbackDataset(
  fields=[
    rg.TextField(name="prompt", required=True),
    rg.TextField(name="completion", required=True),
  ],
  questions=[
    rg.TextQuestion(
      name="question-1",
      description="This is the first question",
      required=True,
    ),
    rg.RatingQuestion(
      name="question-2",
      description="This is the second question",
      required=True,
      values=[1, 2, 3, 4, 5],
    ),
  ],
)

dataset.add_records([
  rg.FeedbackRecord(
    fields={
      "prompt": "The quick brown fox",
      "completion": "jumps over the lazy dog.",
    },
    responses=[
      {
        "user_id": None,
        "values": {"question-1": {"value": "Response 1"}, "question-2": {"value": 1}},
        "status": "submitted",
      },
    ],
  ),
])

dataset.push_to_argilla(name="my-dataset", workspace="my-workspace")
```

Note that in the snippet above, both `user_id` and `status` are optional, and their default values are `None` and `submitted`, respectively. So that the `user_id=None` is then transformed into the active Argilla `user_id`.

**Type of change**

(Please delete options that are not relevant. Remember to title the PR according to the type of change)

- [X] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [X] Improvement (change adding some improvement to an existing functionality)

**How Has This Been Tested**

- [x] Added integration tests to make sure that adding a response with `user_id=None` fulfils its value to be the active user
- [x] Added integration tests to make sure that a warning is raised in case there's more than one response with `user_id=None` for the same record, and that the response is not logged into Argilla

**Checklist**

- [X] I have merged the original branch into my forked branch
- [X] follows the style guidelines of this project
- [X] I did a self-review of my code
- [X] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works

title: Copying text without the copy button in `FeedbackDataset` results in weird textfield formatting

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**
Copying text without the copy button in `FeedbackDataset` results in weird textfield formatting

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Copy text without coppy button
2. Paste it in a text field

**Expected behavior**
I would expect to just get the text.

**Screenshots**
![image](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/assets/25269220/fde2fe3b-45e1-4c5a-94c2-985b126408b5)


**Environment (please complete the following information):**
N.A.

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: chore: added very rough outline prepare_for_training with FeedbackDat…
body:
…aset

# Description

I added a very rough outline of my ideation behind `prepare_for_training` with the new `FeedbackDataset`. As discussed there are 3 complexities:

- How to resolve annotator alignment?
- How to resolve optional fields, which have not been filled out? e.g., "Please provide a correction for prompt 1?".
- How handle potential concatenation of fields? 

To make it modular I created a step-wise approach.

1. `Pydantic` Models that map and verify data fields, like so. By doing this we keep the flexibility to allow for other tasks like TextClassification and this ensures we can directly use `datasets.field` and `dataset.questions` for defining training. We could also use the `name` values from the fields/questions, but this might be more error prone.
2. `get_relevant_data_for_training()` in `List[dict]` format with all relevant fields from the Pydantic model. **annotator alignment issue**. For now I opted for choosing the first non-zero value.
3. Forward the `List[dict]` to a similar flow we previously had.
4. Also add `dataset.unify_responses(question, Enum(strategy))`-method


```python
class TrainingDataForTextClassification(BaseModel):
    text: TextField
    label: Union[RatingQuestion, SingleLabelQuestion, MultiLabelQuestion]
    label_unifier: Enum(strategies)
    # TODO: validation for strategy against question type
```

```python 
import os

import argilla as rg
from argilla.client.feedback import (
    TrainingDataForLLMFineTuningChat,
)

rg.init(api_url=os.environ.get("ARGILLA_API_URL_DEV"), api_key=os.environ.get("ARGILLA_API_KEY_DEV_PRE"))

dataset = rg.FeedbackDataset.from_argilla(
    name="test_feedback_dataset-natalia",
    workspace="workspace-0",
    with_records=False,
)

fields = dataset.fields
questions = dataset.questions
# property method for field
training_data = TrainingDataForLLMFineTuningChat(prompt=fields[0], context=fields[1], response=questions[4])
print(training_data)

print(
    dataset.prepare_for_training(
        framework="autotrain",
        training_data=training_data,
        train_size=0.8,
    )
)
```

Closes #2954

**Type of change**

- [X] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [X] Improvement (change adding some improvement to an existing functionality)

- [ ] Test A
- [ ] Test B

title: Add `format_as`, `push_to_huggingface`, & `from_huggingface` in `FeedbackDataset`

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
# Description

This PR adds some methods to the `rg.FeedbackDataset` as follows:

* `format_as` to format the records of the existing dataset as 🤗`datasets` format (i.e. `datasets.Dataset`) to be extended to support other formats like `pandas` or `numpy`
* `push_to_huggingface` to push the existing records and dataset configuration to the HuggingFace Hub (including an auto-generated dataset card! 🎉)
* `from_huggingface` is a classmethod to load a `rg.FeedbackDataset` from the HuggingFace Hub, pulling the dataset itself (records and annotations) and the configuration (guidelines, fields, and questions)

Closes #2765

**Type of change**

- [X] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)

title: List all the `FeedbackDataset` responses not just the current user's
body:
# Description

As recently spotted by @nataliaElv, we were just listing the current dataset records with their annotations, instead of all the available record annotations, as we were sending the request to `GET /api/v1/me/datasets/{id}/records` instead to `GET /api/v1/datasets/{id}/records`, so removing the prefix `/me` solves this issue.

Kudos to @nataliaElv 🎉

title: [Question] multiple multiclass for same text classification task
body:
Hi, I am very interested in using argilla in my company. Very exciting solution/software.

My question is the following: imagine I have an excel file, where each row is a text, and I want to do text classification. In excel, I can create multiple columns, each with its own drop down menu. Is something like this possible in argilla? For example, for the same text I could choose one of [sports, tech, finance] AND [well written,  poorly written], representing this as two columns in the excel sheet. I read the documentation, but every example I saw would only show me how to configure this as pick multiple or one from [sports, tech, finance, well written, poorly written].

Any thoughts? Thanks in advance!!

title: Increase `codecov` threshold to avoid status checks from failing due to it
body:
# Description

Tiny PR to update the `.codecov.yml` configuration file to relax the restrictions from `codecov` in the current status checks, since it's making a lot of status checks in PRs fail due to a super small code coverage change e.g. 0.1

So on, the new configuration file uses `target: auto` to compare the coverage of the current code with the previous base commit used to calculate the diff, and `threshold: 2%` to allow a 2 percent difference with respect to the base commit coverage.

**Type of change**

- [X] Improvement (change adding some improvement to an existing functionality)

title: `argilla server` fails on Python 3.10 and Python 3.11

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
**Describe the bug**

As of the recent addition of the `Questions` schema for the `/api/v1`, the `typing.Annotated` has been introduced, and it seems to be failing under the following condition:

```python
from pydantic import BaseModel, Field
from typing import Union
from sqlalchemy import JSON
from sqlalchemy.orm import Mapped, relationship

class A(BaseModel):
  a: int

class B(BaseModel):
  b: int

AB = Annotated[Union[A, B], Field(..., discriminator="type")

class ABTable(Base):
    __tablename__ = "ab"

    settings: Mapped[dict] = mapped_column(JSON, default={})
    ab: Mapped["Whatever"] = relationship(back_populates="ab")

    @property
    def parsed_settings(self) -> AB:
        return parse_obj_as(AB, self.settings)
```

With the following error: `sqlalchemy.exc.InvalidRequestError: When initializing mapper Mapper[Question(questions)], expression 'Union' failed to locate a name ('Union'). If this is a class name, consider adding this relationship() to the <class 'argilla.server.models.questions.Question'> class after both dependent classes have been defined.`

Indeed, the code at https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/blob/feat/2615-instructions-task/src/argilla/server/models/questions.py

**To Reproduce**

Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Install Argilla from source as `pip install git+https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla.git@feat/2615-intructions-task`
2. Run `python -m argilla server` from either Python 3.10 or 3.11 (as it works with other Python versions)

**Expected behavior**

`argilla server` should properly launch the Argilla Server in any Python version within the range of Python 3.7 and Python 3.11.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS [e.g. iOS]: macOS
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: N/A
 - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: 1.8.0-dev0
 - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: 8.5.3 (but fails regardless the ElasticSearch version)
 - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. argilla:v1.0.0]: N/A

title: Using an already setup httpx client in sdk modules
body:
# Description

Since the new SDK modules are creating a new httpx client on each request, some problems related to connection performance can be raised. In the [official docs](https://www.python-httpx.org/advanced/) you can read: 

> When you make requests using the top-level API as documented in the [Quickstart](https://www.python-httpx.org/quickstart/) guide, HTTPX has to establish a new connection for every single request (connections are not reused). As the number of requests to a host increases, this quickly becomes inefficient.
> 
> On the other hand, a Client instance uses [HTTP connection pooling](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTTP_persistent_connection). This means that when you make several requests to the same host, the Client will reuse the underlying TCP connection, instead of recreating one for every single request.

In order to better use the httpx client, this PR changes the `sdk` module to reuse the already set up httpx client in the `AuthenticatedClient` instance.

By using this client, you don't need to pass header or base URL configuration on each request, since is setup on client initialization.

title: Button to close `Metrics` in UI closing the panel but not releasing the occupied space

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: ui
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the User Interface (UI)

body: **Describe the bug** When opening the `Metrics` bar from the left panel button and trying to close it with the `>` symbol on the top left of the opened panel, it closes it, but the space occupied by it remains until refreshing the page, either via the `Refresh` button or pressing F5, Ctrl+R, or any other command to refresh the page. It does work indeed, when clicking on the `Metrics` button again. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Go to your Argilla instance 2. Open any dataset 3. Click on the `Metrics` button on the left bar 4. Try to close it with the `>` button on the top left of the opened panel **Expected behavior** The `Metrics` panel to be closed and the space occupied by it to be released when clicking on the `>` button. **Screenshots** Here's a short video on what happens: https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/assets/36760800/772c5c88-585a-4727-89a6-0eb18d80cbb6 This is the button that doesn't work as expected: And this is the result when using that button: **Environment (please complete the following information):** - OS [e.g. iOS]: macOS - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]: Chrome, Safari, Arc - Argilla Version [e.g. 1.0.0]: Latest (1.8.0) - ElasticSearch Version [e.g. 7.10.2]: N/A - Docker Image (optional) [e.g. argilla:v1.0.0]: N/A

title: Admin users can create records with responses for several users
body:
# Description

WARNING !!! This PR changes the records creation endpoint.

Instead of passing a single response, now the endpoint accepts a list of user responses. This allows admins to restore a backup of the dataset.

@alvarobartt  Once this PR is merged in the feature branch, you should adapt the add_records method to accept a list of users' responses. See [here](https://github.com/argilla-io/argilla/blob/6fe3d3c2f9c958435e660d192e081203453bf1cb/src/argilla/server/schemas/v1/datasets.py#L228) for the schema definition.

Closes #2903

title: Drop Python 3.7 support due to its EOL in ~1.5 months

labels.name: type: deprecation
labels.description: Indicates a feature that will be deprecated and/or support will be dropped

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

As Python 3.7 end-of-life (EOL) date is close, we should drop support for Python 3.7 before the next `argilla` release, as most of the Python package maintainers are doing e.g. https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow, https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch, ...

More information on the Python 3.7 EOL at https://endoflife.date/python

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Minimum required version to install Argilla should be 3.8 while we can either leave the maximum supported version unpinned (3.11 as of today) or pinned to lower than 3.12 (>=3.8,<3.12).

**NOTE: We need to update documentation references to Python 3.7 setup and remove the current deprecation warning in `__init__.py`**

title: Show empty guidelines message when dataset has no guidelines
Save partial responses on Discard

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When I discard a response in a feedback dataset, it only gets saved when I answered all required questions. I want to be able to save the response even if it's partial.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The response should be saved upon clicking Discard (whether the response is complete or just partial).

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

title: Message that warns about losing changes multiplies

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When I get the toast message that warns the user about losing changes, it multiplies if I click on 'Next' before closing the message. 
This happens over all types of datasets.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I'd like to see the message only once. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

**Additional context**
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.

title: Add `KerasNLP` integration in `ArgillaTrainer`

labels.name: type: enhancement

labels.description: Indicates integrations with third parties

labels.name: area: trainer
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the Argilla Trainer

body:
**Describe the solution you'd like**

I think it'll be nice to integrate [`KerasNLP`](https://github.com/keras-team/keras-nlp) as another integrated framework for the `ArgillaTrainer` to also allow users train/fine-tune Keras models.

More information at https://keras.io/keras_nlp/
